Question: How can i pass all integers i this loop and stop before the last line: :this is my inputfirst line5 63 42 32 51 0word 2 2 4i need to add all the integers to a graph but not the last line (word 1 2 4).. i have splitted the first line (first line etc.) and put them in a arraylist.. No problem therebut then i have this for-loopfor (int i = 0; i < (amount of lines); i++) {        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(in.readLine());        graph.addEdge(Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken()), Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken()));    }i cant write in the code how many times i want it to put integers, because my code should run generally with other inputs...How can i make it stop before the last line, i still need to be able to use the last bufferreaderline
Please using this api: StringTokenizer.nextToken.
Answer: You can use the `hasMoreTokens` method of StringTokenizer to check if there are more tokens left in the line. If there are, you can parse the next token and add it to the graph. If not, you can break the loop. Here is how you can modify your for-loop:

```java
for (int i = 0; i < (amount of lines); i++) {
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(in.readLine());
    while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
        graph.addEdge(Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken()), Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken()));
    }
    if (!st.hasMoreTokens()) {
        break;
    }
}
```

This way, the loop will break when there are no more tokens left in the line, effectively skipping the last line.

Note: Make sure to replace `(amount of lines)` with the actual number of lines you want to read. If you don't know the number of lines in advance, you can use a while loop instead of a for loop and read lines until `in.readLine()` returns null.

Also, make sure to handle the IOException that `in.readLine()` may throw. You can do this by wrapping your code in a try-catch block or by checking if the line read is null before trying to parse it.

Lastly, make sure that the graph you are using has a method `addEdge` that takes two integers as parameters and adds an edge between them. If it doesn't, you will need to modify the code accordingly.
